intro: Cistus villosus var. tauricus, commonly known as the Tauric rockrose, is a flowering shrub native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its gray-green, hairy leaves and clusters of pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. It is drought-tolerant and adapted to full sun, making it a hardy species for xeriscaping. Its aromatic foliage and ornamental flowers make it a valued plant in both natural and cultivated landscapes.
